utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Let's get back to Phil and Diane. Phil's been having a hard time finding work, and Diane wants him to talk to her about his fear, his disappointment. And Phil wants Diane to trust him that they'll get through this, ideally, without having to keep discussing… feelings. Not your exact words, but am I wrong?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: And most guys out there are the same way, but ladies, if you're feeling frustrated, remember… it's not our fault. We were raised to be strong, not emotional, to deny vulnerability, not embrace it. And do you know what that makes us? Dinosaurs. Nobody needs us to hunt wild animals for food. Nobody needs us to cut down trees to build shelter. They need us to evolve, to catch up.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Since the 1960s, women's roles have shifted radically. And as -- uh, as their-- in--as their roles have changed, so have women, they've -- they've, uh -- well, they've become tougher, and more demanding of us. They're partners. And–and -- who can blame them? Who –- who can -- who can, uh… expecting us to -- to do this—

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Joe! Joe! Joe! Joe.

utterance.speaker: Aide
utterance.content: We need an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You want?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm good. Your limp's almost gone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It pains me to interrupt the collegial banter, it pains me even more to listen to it continue. 38-year-old man. Spikes a fever and collapses during a speaking engagement. E.R. checks out blood volume, cardiac function, and autonomic reflexes, all normal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patient makes a living telling men to behave more like women. I'm surprised you didn't throw psych symptoms into the differential. Either way, could be a cerebral AVM.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: E.R. did a head CT. No sign of AVM. Decent thought, though.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The patient's philosophy makes perfect sense. Its only flaw is that it's impossible. Evolution does not work that way. You can't talk legs onto a fish. We're gonna go extinct, and we're gonna do it drinking scotch and driving muscle cars. Am I right? Am I— Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cephalic fibromuscular dysplasia?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It doesn't explain the fever. The patient's talking about compromise. If you don't think that's possible, you don't think relationships are possible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anyone in this room in a position to disprove that?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: This guy's just playing to his audience. Women are, by far, the biggest consumers of the self-help industry.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He could have a pulmonary embolism. Clot in his lung increases right ventricular afterload, drops the blood flow to his brain. We should do a pulmonary angiogram.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Patient lacks major risk factors for a P.E. Doesn't rule it out, just makes it unlikely. Maybe we start with a D-dimer?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Less invasive than the angiogram. Good idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Now, I am hereby searching for a number two. So I'm eating a lot of bran. Also, I want a team leader. Someone to fill Foreman's old job.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. We don't need any more structure. It's not like we had a near-fatal stabbing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if it isn't the old ball and Ukraine.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Who's that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His wife.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dominika.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: House. You survived prison.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you Atlantic City, where they also have gangs and pruno, but slightly less recidivism.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I start Ukrainian food truck business. After gambling — win, lose — everybody likes a little knish.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're here, and I seem to remember throwing out a bunch of certified letters from immigration. I'm assuming there's a connection.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Our green card interview is in four days. They come to the apartment, they ask questions about marriage, vacations, family history, what side of the bed each sleep on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We've never taken a vacation, I don't like your family, and on top. I hear Kiev is lovely this time of year. And your mother, who may or may not be dead for all I know, misses you.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Can it be that genius doctor is afraid to take on a silly government apparatchik?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I would say more not interested than afraid, but why quibble?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Then I go to plan "B." Make you an offer that cannot be refused.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How long you been doing seminars?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: The marriage counseling, just, uh, the past couple years. Before that, I did corporate coaching.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Can't imagine the same advice works for both audiences. Guess you shifted with the market?

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: There's nothing cynical about my husband. He and I—

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: No, it's okay. I get it. What guy thinks men should be more like women? A macho jerk who got a big wake-up call courtesy of three drunks who beat the crap outta me outside a sports bar in Milwaukee.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm guessing that explains the broken wrist in your medical history?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Those morons did me the biggest favor of my life. I realized I'd sacrificed my health because I couldn't back down from an argument over football. Meeting Marlene was the final piece in the puzzle. She changed my career, my diet. She gave me a whole new direction in life.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We'll need to know exactly how you changed your diet, and when.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Need my apartment key back.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you're breaking up with me, can we at least talk about it first?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe if you weren't all nag and no shag.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't sleep with married men.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll get a copy made.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're an ex-con. If you get caught perjuring yourself to Homeland Security, you'll end up back in jail.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And that would be troubling if there was the slightest chance that we'd get caught.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You barely know each other. You've got about five minutes to remake yourselves into a convincing married couple. And… why? Dominika gets a green card. What's in this for you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is what men do for the women they pretend to love. Also, she's paying me 30,000 bucks once we pass. Apparently knishes sell like hotcakes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lab results.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Afraid you're gonna have to finish your nag later.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I said I think it's stupid, right? Then I think I'm done.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: D-dimer came back normal. Rules out pulmonary embolism.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And our patient's a true believer about the follies of masculinity. He underwent a spiritual overhaul three years ago. He also went off gluten and red meat. Unfortunately, that doesn't explain any of his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One of those points is not absurd.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What's absurd about a change of heart? What this guy believes is making him a better person. He's going against his baser instincts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Base" meaning foundational. Meaning things we are biologically programmed to do. Yes, perfectly natural that he stopped doing that stuff. You know, that's the kind of lapse that could take you out of the running for team leader.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I feel surprisingly okay with that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Comes with a 50-buck-a-week raise.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm in.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You don't want to do that. Might need your dignity later in life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn't. And she could be on her way to living the dream unless the rest of you nut up and give her— This spiritual overhaul… did it come after a physical overhaul? A major injury of some kind?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Bar fight. But there's no way a broken wrist explains—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Adams, come with me. You too. You guys… get a copy of that made.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did those dudes bend your ball sack like Beckham? Three years ago. The bar fight.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: This is Dr. House. He has a theory.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, Dr. Adams, would you mind? I asked you a question. I assume you know the answer.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Yeah, I took a couple serious knees to the groin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wha — what has gotten into me? Dr. Chase. Just pick it up.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Do you know what's wrong with me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing that The Golden Girls couldn't have handled in 23 hilarious minutes. You had a hot flash. Those guys kicked your guys hard enough to do lasting damage. You didn't even look when presented with two reasonably attractive tuchi. Yeah, I said it!

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I was listening to my doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: People generally listen with their ears, leaving their eyes free to wander. I'm guessing that your testosterone level is just below "Bieber." Do a blood test to confirm, and start hormone replacement. It's no wonder that you think women are so great. You've basically been one for the last three years.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tests confirm House is right. Low testosterone explains all your symptoms. They should go away with replacement therapy. Uh, we're gonna give you a fairly high dose. Over time, your personal physician may reduce it a little. Just need you to turn around.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Will the shots increase his libido?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Are you worried about that?

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Have you been unsatisfied?

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: No. No, it's just… Well, it's usually me that initiates things. Sometimes I–I think maybe you aren't that attracted to me.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Are you crazy?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: With these injections, you will see an increase in sex drive.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Okay, great.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: All done.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Okay. Oh, something's wrong. I think I peed myself.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Is that from the testosterone?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It couldn't be. I don't think you're going home just yet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not a plumbing problem. Means it's probably neurological.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And name Dominika's three brothers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh… Volodymyr, Oleksiy, and… aaugf.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Low testosterone is off the table as a symptom. Guy got his nuts cracked three years ago. Don't need to look much further than that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So his hose just happens to spring a leak at the same time he's in a hospital for a totally unrelated problem. Fjodor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's Fedir.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If low testosterone means I can't get sick with something else, then punch me in the junk right now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I would, if it weren't redundant. Is Fedir the one who married Mykola?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mykola is… Dominika's uncle?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How is it you can retain every detail of our habits and personal lives, and none of this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause I find it hard to remember things I don't give a crap about. Ergo, Dominika has one brother, and his name is Al.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maybe the testicular damage set the stage for something worse. Multiple Sclerosis causes incontinence, and progresses faster in men with low T.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Way to stay on point. It's that kind of leadership that's putting you at the head of the pack.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There is no pack. She's the only applicant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that's settled, then. Have your underlings do an LP and get a cranio-spinal MRI to check for plaques associated with M.S. I will go tell Foreman about your promotion.

utterance.speaker: Chase and Adams
utterance.content: Wait.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So nobody cares about the job till I apply, and suddenly it's the last limited-edition light saber at Comic-Con.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just seems like it should go to someone with more… seniority.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Meaning you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I said "more," not "most."

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Meaning you or Taub.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House is a dictator. Second in command is a meaningless position.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Doesn't look meaningless on my resume.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Doesn't have to be meaningless at all. The right person could turn it into something. Get the department running smoothly.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I wonder who that "right person" could be.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: House is the head of the department. It's only fair that a woman should hold the other position of authority.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yeah, let's go affirmative action on this, because then I'll definitely win.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is what House wants. Wind us up and watch us fight over an empty title, which would make us extra stupid because of what we've just been through. We should let him choose whoever he wants and move on.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: So if these proteins are in my spinal fluid, that means I have M.S.?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Proteins may indicate M.S. There's no one definitive test. That's why Dr. House ordered an MRI as well.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: This is anesthetic. It's a scary diagnosis. But advances are being made. Several drugs approved just this year.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: To be honest, at the moment, I'm feeling a little more worried about the testosterone injections. It's making me feel, uh, different. Just kind of amped. I went through this big life change, and it felt really… meaningful. But what if it was all just chemistry?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Loss of testosterone could have been a factor, but think of it as a catalyst. It got you to reevaluate. Now you know what's important. You can choose to hold onto that. Right?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's certainly worth trying. Deep breath. Stay very still.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just tell House to drop the whole team leader thing. That's the only way it'll go away.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't think it's such a bad idea. A little more structure in your department couldn't hurt.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah. House is doing this because of his great love of structure, not because he wants us to turn on each other.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So don't do that. It makes sense to have someone in there with a little more accountability.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: As long as it's not Adams. She sees the whole thing as an opportunity to remake the department in her image. Or Park, for obvious reasons. And Taub's got the kids. He's pretty busy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Are you seriously angling for a job that you mocked its fate the whole time I had it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't want the job.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You just don't want anyone else to have it. This'll be great.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your grandmother's kind of sexy.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: That is Taras Shevchenko, the greatest Ukrainian poet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is he the guy behind "There once was a man from Kremenchuk"?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Help me move coffee table.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, then where will we have coffee? And by "coffee" I mean scotch.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Coffee and booze are artificial high for me. High is in exercise.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Dance aerobics. Fun, and good for the butt.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Whoo!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Amy Grant?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. But there's a hot girl jumping up and down in my living room, so…

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Aww!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You have a limited amount of time to learn a ton of uninteresting facts. Welcome to my wheelhouse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You brought a protractor?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You never know when you might need to make a pie chart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like someone is currying favor for the team leader position.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yes. We'll be using a basic alphabet technique with a mnemonic multiplier. In high school, they called me "The Bookie Monster." Pop quiz. Where did you get the candlesticks? On three. One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Morocco.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Denver.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Drink up. It's gonna be a long night.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You really think this guy's gonna hulk out once the hormones kick in?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Some male lizards do push-ups to attract mates. When scientists gave them extra testosterone, they did push-ups until they died. Same drive you took advantage of to get Chase to carry a box of files down to your car yesterday.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Periventricular and subcortical white matter are clean. So you're saying masculinity is ingrained and irrational.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm saying it's pointless to try—

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: By extension, you're also saying femininity is enlightened and rational. It's the way we should all be, guys just are incapable of it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Brain stem and cord are clean.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Is it okay if I scratch my nose?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Go ahead. Guess he doesn't have M.S.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Something's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Is it your hand?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: No, it's my eyes. I'm–I'm seeing double.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Smile. It's your honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what causes double vision on top of all the other symptoms?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's not a brain tumor or we would've seen it on the scans. Eye exam didn't offer anything conclusive.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Let's do some winter shots. Wardrobe change.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thyroid eye disease in conjunction with Graves.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thyroid level was normal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Check it out. Simpson traded this in exchange for me helping out on some of my days off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Quite the display of initiative and leadership.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: But you're way too smart to fall for a blatant bribe like that.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Or a blatant flaunting of cleavage. Like those.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What happened to not letting House get to you? You're like lemmings, marching off the cliff of competitive humiliation.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: All I'm doing is my job. House has indicated that he considers me attractive. There's nothing wrong with me using my strengths to my advantage.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: With an argument like that, maybe you should just drop down to your knees and — I mean, unless that's not your strength.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Oh, big hug, big man. It's cold out here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: At the risk of derailing this very productive photo shoot and bickering session, what about myasthenia gravis? Extra-ocular muscle weakness leads to double vision, atonic bladder leads to incontinence. Could've been triggered when his T got really low.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Ooh, a little one. He'd be a good pick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Smooth. You let the rest of them compete, tear each other to pieces, then you swoop in with a save. Start the patient on IVIG and plasmapheresis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Can you handle that, please? I need a minute.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, make it quick. We're doin' Memphis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You think you want this, but it's a bad idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was gonna go Dollywood, but I'm not sure I could pull off that wig.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everybody was playing nice, and in your world, nice doesn't solve cases, but after what happened, a little bonding is a good thing. We still have ideas, we still argue. Maybe it could work better if we appreciate each other.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was impressive. You said that whole thing without once moving your lips. The ones you're not moving.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh. I get it. I won't play along with your stupid games, so I'm no longer a man. Clever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, you won't play along with my stupid games because you're no longer a man. Still clever, though. Studies have shown that raising kids lowers testosterone levels in men. The more involved you are, the lower it gets.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Right. Having kids has neutered me. Or maybe it's helped me finally grow up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: As long as I keep my eyes closed, pretty good. Really good, actually. I got energy, I feel confident, clear.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Testosterone does tend to perk you up.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Hey, Hon. I brought you a burger.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: You're in the hospital. Eat whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: You're the best wife ever. And I'm not just saying that because of how great your ass looks in those jeans. I'm sorry. That was—

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: No, it's okay. Girl likes to know she's appreciated.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Come here. So I think we should talk to Leading Lights about seminars and DVDs.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Are you sure? You were worried about the commitment.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Yeah, there's no point in being in business with them halfway. You okay with that?

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: It's good to finally have a decision.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fedir is the brother she worries about the most. Ever since Luba passed. Sorry. But this is the closest we could find to the cold, soulless offices of a government bureaucracy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you're not using your office, I will.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Does Dominika still communicate with her high school friends?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, Vasyl, yes. Oksana, no. Not since she kissed Pavlo. 'Cause that bitch knew that Dominika liked him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wrong.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Oh, Oksana is a slut. Dead to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The right answer is the wrong answer. No husband would pay that much attention to his wife's friend dramas.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Haven't you been divorced three times?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: In-between those divorces, I was married, non-fraudulently, for 12 years total, which is 12 years longer than anyone in this room. Move.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So are you going for this team leader thing?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Probably.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You deserve it. You have way more experience than me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're giving up?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I wish. I still have a lot of med school debt, and my parents need help with their mortgage. So I could kinda use the money.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: As of an hour ago, I'm just seeing one of everything. Looks like you guys were right—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We'll be right back. "I could use the money"? You want to game me, you gotta do better than that.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Chase—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want to be a leader, you have to know how to manipulate. You can't just spill—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I think the whites of his eyes were yellow.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Jaundice.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: There's something wrong with your liver.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Liver function tests confirm his enzymes are totally out of whack.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So much for myasthenia gravis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can we hurry this up? I have a government to defraud at noon.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: If you need to leave, you should. I'm fairly confident our patient's got sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Wow, you said that with so much authority. Did anyone else get chills?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just until I realized our patient has no sign of parenchymal lung abnormalities, which makes sarcoidosis a long shot. And bookkeeping isn't gonna get you any farther than boobs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Though in fairness, the boobs were really, really helping.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I still think it's myasthenia gravis.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Did you miss the recap? We treated for that. The liver tanked.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But his vision got better.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Liver problems could be a sign of celiac. He's been back on gluten since he's been in the hospital. Yesterday he had a burger.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That would've kicked the celiac into gear, causing the liver problems.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So your theory is that he has two unrelated diseases. And he's already got low testosterone. I seem to remember something about House hating coincidences.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's true.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I think it's Lyme disease. One single disease named "Lyme."

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Without a rash.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 10% of cases present without a rash.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lyme disease it is. Start the patient on antibiotics. Now I have to get home before my fake wife gets real annoyed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Something bothering you?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I asked the nurse for an extra pillow. That was half an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sorry. Things can get pretty hectic.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: It was a pillow. I mean, how hard can a pil — Listen to me. I'm being a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Testosterone can give you a shorter temper even when you're not sick. You noticed and adjusted. That's a good thing.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Hey. Just got a call from our lawyer. You changed our counter to leading lights?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: You deserve proper billing and a salary bump in the second term.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: We talked about this. We decided it wasn't worth potentially blowing the deal.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: It'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: I've got to get some work done.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: These are such pretty flowers you buy for me every Friday, from Japanese florist, on corner of Edison and Conway.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just one more thing. With this ring, I thee wedded. You left it here when you skipped town with your boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: You kept the rings.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, I tried to trade them to a hooker for unspecified favors, but it turns out she doesn't accept zinc.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Like modern fairytale.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Dr. and Mrs. Gregory House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Nate Weinmann. U.S. Immigration.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Welcome to our home.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Give him time. When I was 14, there was a girl I wanted to impress, so I jumped off the roof of her house. Broke my ankle. Joe's basically going through puberty. It'll take him a while to adjust.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: I-I tracked down a video from one of Joe's business coaching seminars from before I knew him.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I'm hearing a lot about the value of compromise. We don't live on Sesame Street. We live in the real world, the business world. If you're not a winner, you're a loser. If you aren't comfortable with that, go open a pottery studio.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: I never would have gone out with the guy in this video.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Uh, do you remember the last time she visited Vasyl?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, let me see, that would be… August? No. No, July. 'Cause I remember it was right after our half-anniversary, and I forgot to put a gift in her suitcase. And… I've never heard the end of that one.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: House specialty. I made up this pun.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Is it — Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Honey, why do you do this to me? You know I'm watching my weight.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Then maybe you'll stop eating cheese in front of open fridge in middle of the night.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: This is delicious.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: So everything looks good in here. I'm just gonna step out and get a corroborating interview from one of the neighbors.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Neighbors? It's-it's middle of the day. I-I-I think everybody's at work.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Yeah, then they're at work. I just got a form to check off, and you will be on your way to permanent status.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: 'Scuse me, sir. Do you have a minute?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Do you know Dr. and Mrs. House?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Of course, they've been my neighbors about two years, now. Lovely couple. I see them almost every night. They seem always to be together.

utterance.speaker: Weinman
utterance.content: Great, well, thanks for your help.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cheerio.

utterance.speaker: Hastings
utterance.content: Hey, what're you doing? That's my door.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Handing out menus for a new Chinese place.

utterance.speaker: Hastings
utterance.content: You're that guy that plays noisy video games with House on Saturday nights.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's a simple explanation.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Be at my office tomorrow at 10.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The patient's shown zero improvement.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because he's only been on the antibiotics overnight.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or because he doesn't have Lyme disease. Where are you?

utterance.speaker: Ayres
utterance.content: House. Hang up.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I still think it's myasthenia gravis plus celiac. His change in diet has to be significant.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We just need to do an intestinal biopsy to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: With his low platelet count, a biopsy puts him at risk for an abdominal bleed, which puts him at risk of death.

utterance.speaker: Ayres
utterance.content: Either you're done, or you're walking in there without a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know, it sounds like a phone, but it's a timer to remind me to pee before our meeting. Hello, old chap.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You need to save yourself. I was up last night trying to find another angle, but I can't. Tell immigration you were in love with Dominika, but your marriage fell apart, and that's why you haven't been living together.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She'll be deported, permanently.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, I know you like Dominika, you have fun with her, but you got caught. There's no getting out of this. The best you could hope for is that you don't go back to jail.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell my team to-to skip the biopsy and give the antibiotics more time.

utterance.speaker: Ayres
utterance.content: They're ready for us.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I drew a line in the sand, and I won. We should be celebrating.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Do you need a few minutes?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I’d rather keep getting better.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: That's just it. You won. You made a demand that could've blown up the deal, and you never even asked me.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Deal didn't blow up. They caved.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: Joe, you say it in your seminars. Process matters just as much as results.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Are you seriously busting my chops because I made one little move without you? How 'bout stepping aside and letting me be the man in this relationship for a change?

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: I really can't talk to you right now.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I don't know why I said that. Just — I got so angry.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Hopefully after this dose, you'll start to feel better, and we can get you home. But I'd like to do one more test.

utterance.speaker: Ayres
utterance.content: The testimony of one angry, nearsighted neighbor shouldn't outweigh all other evidence. Photos, utility bills—

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Yes, because your clients would never fake anything.

utterance.speaker: Ayres
utterance.content: Uh, we acknowledge the neighbor thing was a mistake, but that doesn't mean that all of the other documentation should just be thrown out.

utterance.speaker: Weinman
utterance.content: Look, look, you know, I get that it's your job to try to act like there's a case here, but shut up.

utterance.speaker: Ayres
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: USCIS will be denying Miss Petrova's green card application. You'll be referred to immigration court for deportation proceedings, and we're gonna inform your parole officer about evidence of fraud. So, unless anybody has anything else to add…

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Please, I am begging, do not send him back to jail. Maybe we have not lived together all these—

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: Mrs. House, I have to advise you not to continue.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: This man and I, did we marry for love? No. But this past week, we have a lot of fun. Working really hard to fool the U.S. government, right?

utterance.speaker: Ayres
utterance.content: Don't answer that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Way ahead of you.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: It was fake, but… it felt real. Maybe because it become real. This man — my husband — I want to stay with him, but if I cannot, please send me away, and let him be free. I love him.

utterance.speaker: Weinmann
utterance.content: I didn't buy a word you said. But a judge might. I'm gonna let you stay. But for the next six months, I'm gonna hold onto this file, and our investigators are gonna show up unannounced at 6:00 a.m., 11:00 at night, and they better find the two of you sitting on the couch, watching NCIS, eating ice cream from the same spoon. Or both of you will be sent to places far less pleasant than New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What you just said in there…

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Don't worry. I'm much too smart to be falling in love with you. I will be needing extra shelf in bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Abdominal biopsy showed flattened villi. Looks like you were right about celiac.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You do remember Chase got stabbed doing a test House didn't order?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Good comparison, since both patients were tweaked on steroids.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You only did this to score points over Chase and Park.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We were right. I proved it, and the patient didn't bleed out. Why are you being a jerk about this? Let's go see if House is back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patient's having trouble breathing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: So much for celiac.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His breathing is stabilized, but his lung function is at 60%, and his liver is tanking.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And he has major symptoms of celiac without actually having celiac.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could be Whipple's.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Doesn't explain the incontinence. Intestinal lymphoma?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Doesn't explain the double vision. Any time you want to jump in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is dance aerobics even a thing?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I hear it's good for the butt. What about a parasitic infection? Strongyloides is known to damage the small intestine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: In this country, he's about as likely to get that as win Powerball.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Someone does win Powerball. Every week. The patient went to Puerto Rico a few months ago. One of the few places in the U.S. you could pick up strongyloides.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Treatment is ivermectin. We give that to someone with liver problems, he could have seizures, or worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do it.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I'm hearing a lot about the value of compromise. But we don't live on Sesame Street, we live in the real—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was wondering if maybe we overlooked a symptom, or something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Makes perfect sense. If you're the patient, and "pantywaist" is the symptom.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Adams and I both thought the patient could have celiac, but only she was willing to go out on a limb and run the test. I gave up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now you're in here watching a motivational speech. Even your attempt to get your balls back lacks balls.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: — world, the business world. If you're not a winner, you're a loser.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His voice — it's lower than it is now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If only there was a good reason for a professional speaker to be hoarse.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Go open a pottery studio.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good point.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not a good point. It's a decent point. You're doing it again. You have any other videos? Other seminars?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: A couple.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: When you see a weakness, that's a time for strength. A lot of people say, "Oh, I feel bad about it. The other guy made a mistake."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You bailed too early. Now I get all the credit.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: That kind of thinking is what makes you have a bad day.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chronic hoarseness is a symptom of a condition called silent thyroiditis.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: But I'm not hoarse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly. But you were three years ago. Silent thyroiditis comes and goes. And it, in turn, is a symptom of polyglandular autoimmune syndrome type 3, which makes this a really bad idea. PAS 3 attacks the body's own endocrine system, moving from gland to gland. It started in the thyroid, and probably helped along by your low testosterone, moved on to the gut.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Where it caused celiac disease, or it would've if you weren't on a gluten-free diet. I was right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is incredibly relevant. Eventually, PAS 3 attacked your thymus gland. You developed myasthenia gravis, which landed you in here, and you started eating gluten, which only made things worse.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: So am I gonna be okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We'll treat the various conditions with high-dose steroids. Assuming they respond, you should be fine.

utterance.speaker: Marlene
utterance.content: And the testosterone?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kicked in the nuts is kicked in the nuts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Over the past week, you've all had good moments and bad. No one candidate has prevailed. And so now, we embark upon a contest of medical strength, stamina, and skill.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can we just get this over with?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If the competitor representing Australia would like to take a point deduction, he should, by all means, continue yapping.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Your glee is on the verge of making this not worth it for any of us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can I at least light the torch?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Hurry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I declare open the games of the number one, number two competition. Je declare ouvert— All right. Ready, set, suture!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: T time.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: What happens if I don't take it? Or at least go to a much lower dose?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Are you having side effects?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: No, I feel great. Faster, clearer. More like myself. But my marriage and my career, they're both built on me being somebody else.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Low testosterone can cause depression and problems sleeping. It's also been linked to conditions such as osteoporosis and diabetes. It'll make your life harder and more dangerous on top of all the meds you'll be taking.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I'll take that risk. I'm a better man without it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, this certainly has brought more structure to the department.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really, I'm just excited for the wheelchair race. You were smart not to enter. Never in, never lose. And since you no longer have stones.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll split the 50 a week with you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Honey, I'm home!
